website_summaries.verdict: Enjoy stress-free work away from your computer with this plug-and-play product. You'll get both quality and an affordable price.
pros: Use right away thanks to Logitech Nano receiver
cons: Lag is a common issue with this wireless keyboard/mouse combo

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: The build quality of these keyboards is abysmal, from the Latin "abyssmus," meaning "bottomless pit." So this is an appropriate adjective for the quality, as there seems to be no limit to how poorly this hardware performs. I suppose I should have known that a wireless keyboard and mouse combo that costs like fourteen cents wouldn't be found in Trump Tower. But I don't need anything gold plated or huge. It just needs to work for more than four months. I shouldn't have higher monthly computer accessory costs than my Hulu subscription. Won't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas B. Oman

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard works only part of the time.
customer_reviews.text: I rarely give such a negative review but this specific product deserves it. This was purchased for my husband's computer. The mouse worked fine but the keyboard would not respond at times. He could turn the keyboard on and off and then it would work, but only for a while. We tried changing batteries ... no luck. We tried using different USB ports .. no luck. It would always work for a while ... and then quit. We don't think it's the computer because we ended up borrowing another Logitech wireless mouse/keyboard combo from a neighbor and it works flawlessly. Unfortunately we played around with it way too long to send it back. Won't be buying this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Gigiola

customer_reviews.title: manual says unifying receiver so does box but is not a unifying receiver
customer_reviews.text: I called Amazon and the manual says it is unifying I just bought the Logitech M705 Wireless Marathon Mouse with a unifying receiver it is not a unifying keyboard. Still when I search amazon's sight for Logitech unifying keyboard mouse combo it is number one in results as well as google search. I feel like this was a bait and switch. Manual says unifying receiver so does box but is not a unifying receiver.
customer_reviews.author: John J. Sherwood

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, ok mouse - but neither are compatible with "unifying" logitech devices
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard works well (I like its layout, key size, key travel, and feel), but I don't like the feel of the M185 mouse that comes with it as much as I do the M325 mouse. However... for the price, this is a GREAT combo that is a better option than purchasing the K270 "Unifying" keyboard (which feels very different from this one, and on which I cannot type on reliably) and your favorite mouse separately. Unfortunately, when you purchase this combo set, neither device is "Unifying". Both devices have to be used with the USB stub that comes with them, so you cannot "mix and match" these with other keyboards or mice.
customer_reviews.author: GF

customer_reviews.title: Flawless As Usual
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my new laptop, as I've been told the touch-pad was too touchy and the keys too flat. Both installed within seconds and have worked flawlessly. Can't say I'm surprised. It's Logitech. I assume, when the eventual robot wars come that will wipe out all of mankind, the robots will be made by Logitech. From what I know, the only true way to defeat a Logitech product is to drop it into the toilet. Note to the government; start building giant toilets. But as far as wireless keyboards and mouses go, top notch Logitech. I'm fully ready to accept you as my new robot overlords.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Larochelle

customer_reviews.title: Plug and Play Set UP.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely the easiest set up ever for anyone. Just plug and play. I tried a different one from a different company on amazon and did not notice how bad the reviews were:  When I got that other one I tried getting help with it but all I got was a like for the manufacture with like 50 different down load files i had to read and figure out how it worked. Was way too complicated and just gave up on it. Was a waste of my time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Undecidedly

customer_reviews.title: Not good for gaming
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard buttons became loose after heavy usage especially for gaming when you press the same button a couple of times.
customer_reviews.author: AKN

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like this, it had great reviews
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this, it had great reviews. But this key board is useless. I have it literally next to the computer and it omits letters when I’m typing it it simply does not recognize what I’m typing. Most of the time it’s a delay, so when I don’t see it on the screen I type it again and again and about 10 seconds later it’s all there. Not worth the frustration. I use it for work and I’m typing all day, so this does not work for me at all. I posted a picture of the distance between the laptop and the keyboard, less than a foot apart and does not work!
customer_reviews.author: Cristina B

customer_reviews.title: Saved wear and tear on my laptop. Keyboard feel is mushy.
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard and mouse are useful tools to save wear and tear on my laptop. That being said, the feel of the keyboard isn't satisfying. It's rather mushy and lacks the firm touch of a regular computer keyboard. As such, I often--if not usually--find myself reverting to the laptop's keyboard. The wireless aspect makes it nice to avoid the tangle of cords. And I can use the keyboard from across the room, say when my laptop is connected to my TV. I like that the receiver is tiny and sturdy, unlike another Logitech model's long USB stick receiver that would get bent.
customer_reviews.author: Ky

customer_reviews.title: pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: i bought this for work and i didn't want to spend too much money as i don't have a home PC that i could use this on. the price made me a little apprehensive as usually in terms of electronics you get what you pay for. this is not the case with this keyboard. Both the mouse and keyboard are really nice. the mouse is bare-bones but it will get the job done and I'm pretty impressed with the keyboard. the keys feel really good and it the angle of the keyboard is pretty comfortable. so if you are looking to try a wireless keyboard and don't want to break the bank i think this is a great choice
customer_reviews.author: jaynape3187

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with the mouse.
customer_reviews.text: The mouse is generally responsive EXCEPT that every once in a while when I left-click, I will hear the click but it does not register to the computer. It is as if the microswitch clicks before it contacts, so if you use just the right light touch on the mouse, it clicks but does not register. Conversely, I use the "touch-typing" method where I always keep my fingertips lightly in contact with the keyboard. With previous keyboards, this was never a problem, but with this keyboard I constantly get unwanted letters, especially k and g. It seems that the down-stroke sensitivity on this keyboard is set pretty high.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Manufacture Support
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these back in February of 2017. I really like the tactile feel of the keyboard and the mouse worked great. Then it happened. July 2019 I lost input from the space bar and a couple of other keys. I went to Logitech's site and found out it had a 3 year limited warranty. I sent an email to Logitech about my problems and they returned a email that same day with things to check. I performed their requested checks and it still was broke. Logitech requested proof of purchase, which I downloaded from Amazon, and five days later I received and new unit via UPS. No hassles just straight forward customer support. Kudos to you Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: James Brown

customer_reviews.title: Best set in the $20 range
customer_reviews.text: Got it on Prime Day for $12.50! They showed list price at $21.34, but when you went to check out it knocked $8.84 off for a cost of $12.50. I've bought off brand keyboard and mouse sets in the past for twice the price that were cheesey, plasticy with cheap feeling keys. This set has nice rubber feet on the keyboard that keep it flat without sliding around, keys have good feedback, and action, mouse feels slightly inexpensive, but looks and operates perfectly. Single dongle operates both the keyboard and mouse, connecting automatically to two different Windows 7 PC's immediately on start up. Nice set, even at the $21+ price point.
customer_reviews.author: H J Duff

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY. Keyboard is fine. Mouse appears to have been heavily used. It has gouges on it in various locations and is missing the cover for the optical port. The mouse on the screen jumps a bit but mostly doesn't move when you move the physical mouse. It has been used so much that the battery cover barely stays on. I guess I missed the part of the description that says I was buying unusable items. I would say this review is unbelievable except I have the mouse sitting right in front of me (review written from my phone).
customer_reviews.author: rocket1az

customer_reviews.title: Glitchy, inconsistent
customer_reviews.text: We loved this keyboard and mouse. We bought about 2.5 years ago. About a year ago, the keyboard would start intermittently working. We tried switching it off and on or changing the batteries with no avail. It has slowly gotten worse over time. We would not purchase this brand again. Looking at the other reviews, this appears to be an overall problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice keyboard/mouse, but no number lock indicator
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice keyboard/mouse combo. I'm happy to be rid of the cords. Both the keyboard and mouse require batteries, no problem. I like the 'feel', and it's pretty quiet. My only issue, and the reason I gave it four stars, is that there is no indicator light for the number lock key. I can't tell when it's on or off, and that's a problem entering passwords. I wish they would incorporate an indicator light. There is an indicator light for CAP locks...which is good. Having said this, I liked it enough to buy it again...this is my second one; great price.
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: Received non-Unifying version; interference(?) issues made it unusable
customer_reviews.text: I was satisfied with the build quality of both pieces of this set (as expected given experience using Logitech products over the years); I received the non-Unifying-receiver version and experienced what seemed to be interference (I work in an office with numerous wireless devices operating on various frequencies). Could potentially also have been a power issue as it sometimes seemed one or both units would power down or enter a sleep mode; fresh batteries did not change this nor could I discover any setting that would affect it. I reluctantly returned this. I suspect the Unifying version would work for me as I subsequently began using a Logitech mouse with Unifying receiver and have experienced no issues.
customer_reviews.author: K. Wayman

customer_reviews.title: What were we thinking?
customer_reviews.text: My dad and I bought two of these. The problem is mine has the WORST lagging and his is only used once in a blue moon so he likely doesn't notice. They put a sleep or off button on this thing too that turns off the pc at first I was like hey maybe it's cool cause I can turn it on with it. NO NO you can't! It's pointless... Then there's the stupid different types of batteries in the mouse and keyboard. WHY!?! WE are never buying this again. I like Logitec been buying them for years WORST EVER
customer_reviews.author: M. Bowen

customer_reviews.title: These work great.
customer_reviews.text: One caveat is that the wireless USB dongle seems to draw substantial current, which may be normal for such dongles for all I know, so if you have a bunch of USB-powered devices plugged into jacks that use a single USB controller in the computer (Mac Mini in my case), you might have to start using a wall wart with one of those devices. In my case, an external sound card and a camera were also using substantial current, so I had to power the sound card through its optional power jack to prevent what had been mysterious computer malfunctions.
customer_reviews.author: Splatticus

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in this Logitec wireless keyboard and mouse
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in this Logitec wireless keyboard and mouse. I actually buy Logitec mouse, keyboard etc 95% of the time, I own at least 10 products now, but this one only lasted about 6 weeks. I purchased it on January 23rd and the keyboard expired around March 3rd. I thought it was the batteries in the KB since the mouse is still working, So I changed the battery thinking the battery it came with, since sometimes they are 'trial' batteries. But my new Duracel didn't make it work either. And to make it worst the 30 day Amazon warranty is over. anyway, I would hope this is a one off event. I will still purchase Logitec in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Westridge

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: I like this mouse/keyboard a lot. It is pretty comfortable to use. The only two drawbacks I've noticed are with the keyboard: 1) light weight - sometimes when I use the number pad the whole key board feels wobbly. This could probably be improved by making it heavier 2) Battery life - I seem to go through batteries faster on this keyboard (the mouse is fine) than my previous wireless keyboard. I replace the batteries every 1-2 months on the keyboard, but only every 6 months with the mouse. Overall I would recommend this item as a good basic set up. There are no bells and whistles, but it is a very good value buy.
customer_reviews.author: Rodentia1

customer_reviews.title: For better or worse, you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I don't dislike the mouse and keyboard..but I don't like them either. The keyboard feels like cheap plastic, like the keys feel loose. I actually really hate that. But I like how unintrusive it is sooo.. ? The mouse is fine. Smaller than average, but ULTRA sensitive. If I pick up something from my desk, totally not touching the mouse at all, my computer will wake up from the minor vibration through the desk surface. It's infuriating. So, I'll have to get in the habit of turning the mouse totally off. Honestly, I'd return them, but it's too much of a hassle considering I'm outright not willing to spend more than $20 on a better quality combo.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: The keyboard is super delayed and absolute junk.
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is terrible. delayed, it will take 10-15 seconds to type what you typed, and by then you are trying to go back, or pressing space a bunch to see if it's working. the a key almost never works. Junk. I threw away the box other wise I'd return. Instead, it's going in the garbage. Brand new Lenovo Y700 tower. Mouse is decent, but not worth the $20 I now paid for it. VERY frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Audet

customer_reviews.title: Kind of crazy..
customer_reviews.text: Bad, bad, bad.. I had to have amazon ship me a second set, but even the second one was damaged, so I said "the heck with it" and kept it anyway. They both had the same problems.. They kept disconnecting every so often, on a daily basis, and connects right back, but still annoying when you're in the middle of typing or doing something. And sometimes the keyboard stays stuck on a letter, until it itself decides to stop, even though the key is not pressed down. Its like the keyboard is possessed. If it wasn't for this defect, I would've gave it a five-star. I loved the version before this one, but it eventually died :(
customer_reviews.author: Susana Arroyo

customer_reviews.title: Super loud and annoying
customer_reviews.text: This is not made for people who do not like noises when typing on their keyboard. If you or your partner gets annoyed, this is not for you. My wife constantly would wake up from clicks and I never thought it was comfortable. Plus it would seriously never connect the first time. I was so habitual to go into settings that when I got new a keyboard I kept trying to reconnect it the moment I would get back on the computer. Not a good purchase, much better keyboards out there.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Lagging problems
customer_reviews.text: It never occurred to me that it was my mouse lagging for 15 seconds at a time while gaming - not good. In times, the keyboard is delayed in working. I thought it was my computer. The mouse worked ok for a few months and then this delay problem started up. Switching the mouse made all of the difference in the world. I'm very disappointed as it should have lasted longer than a few months.
customer_reviews.author: S. BENOIT

customer_reviews.title: Best version for best price
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for and the cheaper wireless keyboards suffer from interference and distance envy vs. this one. I was having problems with the cheaper ones going in and out (especially at long 10-15 foot distances). This one works perfectly 100% of the time from anywhere in the room. It also feels high quality when typing. I will use Logitech all the time going forward .
customer_reviews.author: Techmeister

customer_reviews.title: No unifying receiver, buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: No unifying receiver. Deceptive. The K270 which is essentially this same keyboard about without the mouse, comes with a unifying receiver, but the MK270, this one that comes with the mouse, does not. This is unacceptable and the one that recognizes a unifying receiver should be the one sent. Now I have to use two usb ports because I upgraded the mouse that comes with this combo (get the 525, much better).
customer_reviews.author: swash

customer_reviews.title: Eats batteries
customer_reviews.text: I tun the keyboard off when not in use and it still eats batteries. The problem is the signal slows when the batteries are half-way through their life span and does not keep up with moderate typing speed. Also, there is no light for the number lock - this is a problem when you are trying to enter passwords and you are not sure if the numlock is set or not. I like the mouse and have several wireless logitech mice, but the wireless keyboard is not great.
customer_reviews.author: MacGyver

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect combo at an awesome price. Everything I wanted and needed in a Bluetooth keyboard and mouse. Soooooo much better and cleaner looking than dealing with wires. Batteries last forever and haven’t had a single issue since I’ve had. Only suggestion would be adding a light or two for number lock and possibly power status but doing so would also drain the batteries quicker so not a big deal at all. Feels nice to the touch and pressure for keys is perfect. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Dave Owen

customer_reviews.title: Completely non-working from the box.  Would like to request a refund.
customer_reviews.text: This product never worked from the box. I tried changing the batteries, changing the usb port... nothing worked. I set it aside in the original box and forgot about it. I ordered another keyboard, the same one and it is working fine. Now 2 years later, I find this unused keyboard that is still new in the box and it still does not work. Amazon does not give me an option to return, only complain. I would like to have a refund if that is possible.
customer_reviews.author: D&W

customer_reviews.title: My Office go to keyboard and mouse
customer_reviews.text: We purchase these for all of my employees and for home use as well. Keyboard is between medium to quiet sound, there is probably quieter but you can't beat the quality and price. I've used these for years for all of my office employees and home use. I like the one USB for both the keyboard and the mouse versus older models that required 2, one for each. The mouse and keyboard do require AAA batteries. Love this product and the price.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Meadows

customer_reviews.title: Small Mouse, Reliability Concern
customer_reviews.text: Many of the keyboard keys quit working on the 2nd day. From Trouble shooting against several PCs/OSs showed the same behavior so the problem is inside the keyboard, Took apart the keyboard, and by manually connecting some of the lines internally it could type the keys etc, Just not when it was all put back together, So not a software glitch but a hardware problem. Conclusion: The internal engineering design should be made more robust. The mouse is smallish, but has good resistance in the scroller wheel. The usb connector is nice and small, standard logitech. You can get associated software from logitech, but it all feels outdated.
customer_reviews.author: cifey

customer_reviews.title: Was great while it worked
customer_reviews.text: Initially liked this as low-priced yet functional KB/Mouse combo. Everything worked well - size and responsiveness were just right for home/office use. After just 1 year of ownership, keys started to get randomly stuck "on" - notably Shift, Control, Alt - making it impossible to type. This is not a mechanical problem, as the only way to restore functionality is to turn the keyboard on/off. Although only ~$20, expect longer than 1 year lifespan. Have contacted Logitech customer service and will update once there is a reply...
customer_reviews.author: JustSomeGuy

customer_reviews.title: Love the keyboard; Mouse stopped working
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is great and is has all of the functions I need. However, after a year of normal use, the mouse stopped working. I tried pairing, unpairing, changing batteries, different USB port, etc. I wish there was a way to continue to use a paired mouse with this keyboard so that I don't have to use 2 separate USB ports for both my wireless keyboard and wireless mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Luke & Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Good Value Basic Wireless Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Great value for a basic keyboard. It was easy to get started, just plug the plug in to the computer USB port and get typing. Not sure how it would be for gaming, but for office work it works great. For those that like to work in a darker environment, it is not lighted, so another option may be a better choice for you, but for a lighted space it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Heather D Burgess

customer_reviews.title: DID NOT RECEIVE THE NANO RECEIVER with the product
customer_reviews.text: I have heard good things about this wireless set, which is why I ordered it. Unfortunately, because I wasn't using it right away (for work), when I finally did get it out, I realized I did not receive the nano receiver, as has happened to some others here. I say it is unfortunate as it is now past the return window and I am stuck with a keyboard and mouse that I cannot use. So, I am giving it two stars for the good things I heard, but otherwise it is obviously of no use to me. I guess I can take the batteries out and use them for something else!
customer_reviews.author: Lily Jones

customer_reviews.title: Laggy and unresponsive, a big MESS
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my father, he ended having to come back to his old wired keyboard and mouse, the Logitech one lags so bad at the point where its impossible to use money went straight to the trash with this one, I had similar issues with logitech wireless devices seems like the didnt fixed this yet, I purchased this set because the good reviews but seems like all the recent reviews are 1 star like mine complaining about the lag and unresponsiveness
customer_reviews.author: Romano Pérez

customer_reviews.title: I would pay more for a keyboard to work consistantly
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard arrived with batteries that were not great. Keyboard would "go to sleep" and not wake up. I replaced the batteries with new Duracell. The same thing is still happening. I have to restart the computer to get the keyboard to work sometimes after a short period of not using. That does not seem right Update: After 3 months I have replaced the batteries on the keyboard twice with Duracell AAA. The issue is not the batteries, the wireless connectivity is not working consistently. I am shocked this keyboard got such great reviews. It takes longer to do everything, including write this review, when the keyboard is not functioning properly. Spend more $$ and get a better product.
customer_reviews.author: StacyC

customer_reviews.title: CHEAPER THAN STORE-BOUGHT YET THEY WORK
customer_reviews.text: I now have two of these sets one at home and another at the office. I've been using the one in the office for two years now and never have to replace batteries. So I bought another one so that I can use my computer on the 62-inch TV set while using the wireless mouse and keyboard set. It works continuously even if I leave the units ON for two years now. I may be just lucky but I now have two systems and both work without a glitch.
customer_reviews.author: Romanus Maximus

customer_reviews.title: MK 270 -- not unifying receiver
customer_reviews.text: As a previous reviewer noted, there are two versions of the mk 270. This was listed as being a unifying receiever model, but I received a nano receiver that is not a unifying receiver. Since I don't have other logitech products I'm trying to sync, I don't care too much, but this is not how the listing advertising this product. That being said, the product seems to work pretty well -- the keyboard is decent for a $20 keyboard, the mouse is a little small but works, set up was painless, etc. Worked well with my cranky old desktop upgraded to W10 last year.
customer_reviews.author: eggo

customer_reviews.title: Decent keyboard for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard to have as a work keyboard. It has worked well for the most part. There are times when it is pretty laggy or doesn't work for about 10 seconds. It wasn't was a cheap keyboard though so I'm going to harp on that. It is good for what you pay for and does the job. I wouldn't try and use it for anything critical though.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: complete crap, just burn your cash, it's more fun
customer_reviews.text: ok it's cheap but it's also crap. sticky keys, malfunctioning keys and not the same ones day to day. I have had two. I put the first one down to bad luck. the second didn't last as long as the first. I got a warrantee from Amazon BUT THEY DON'T HONOR IT cause the board is too new and getting logitch to replace it is not worth $20 of aggravation dealing with their customer service which is a RUN AROUND not "customer service" complete bullshit
customer_reviews.author: Dale Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Decent enough for the price.
customer_reviews.text: If you just want a cheap wireless mouse and keyboard then this'll work. I haven't had any connectivity or driver issues. Mouse feels really small in my hand and it's all made of a pretty cheap quality plastic, but works well. It shows up on the logitech gaming software but doesn't have any options or adjustable settings, which is kind of weird. DPI could be a little higher. Wouldn't recommend this for higher/long term usage or gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Bones McLure

customer_reviews.title: GOOD QUALITY AND GREAT PRICE
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this board and mouse to use with our desk top computer. The key board that came with the computer was very small, and we wanted a larger key board and mouse. The Logitech key board and mouse served our purpose great. The price was good. We have used Logitech key boards and mouse before. the usually last about a year, so we usually replace it once a year. Reliable and great price.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good range and battery life
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this combo everyday for about 6 weeks and the batteries are still strong even though I never switch the mouse or keyboard off. There are switches provided on both but I just leave them on. The range is very good. I have a computer hooked up to a TV and use both the keyboard and mouse from as far away as kitchen counter about 18' away from the computer; works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Joe M

customer_reviews.title: I don't have any major gripes and would recommend this product to other buyers who are looking for ...
customer_reviews.text: Can't really complain much about a $20 wireless keyboard/mouse combo. I was looking for a keyboard that wasn't compressed/small and this is not, so I appreciate that. It is about as wide as a regular keyboard and it works well. The mouse is a little flimsy feeling, but it feels ok. The cursor seems to move a little too fast for my liking, but I'm sure that can be adjusted through the OS mouse setting. I don't have any major gripes and would recommend this product to other buyers who are looking for a budget friendly wireless keyboard/mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Cyrus

customer_reviews.title: So close, but one fatal flaw, deal breaker
customer_reviews.text: I like so much about this keyboard. It is compact, thus not cluttrng my desk with a larg bulky keyboard ( I have a total of four at my desk area). It connects wll to my computer without needing to install drivers. The problem, which you may have already detected, is that the "e" key skips frquently. As I am a writer, I don't need this to b in the th way. I'm going to try a rplacement but this is not the first incidence of a Logitech wireless and one frequently-used key skipping.
customer_reviews.author: The Conscious Rasta Report

customer_reviews.title: Faulty--errors make this unusable
customer_reviews.text: The mouse works as well as any other wireless mouse I've used. The keyboard, however, is unusable. The "b" key is faulty and goes off when you're not even typing. I came back to an excel sheet I was working on to find a very long thread of "bbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbb". It just went on and on forever. When typing with this keyboard, my emails looked like this, "Hbi, tbeamb, Ib wbantbted tbo brbreabchb boutb abboubbt obubbr brprbobjectb." Also, I've noticed that certain keys will stop working. For example, I couldn't type a capital R. I had to turn the keyboard off and turn it back on. The keyboard simply does not work, and it's disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Haley Rose

customer_reviews.title: Works with Ubuntu 17.04 Linux, good value for the $
customer_reviews.text: Works well with Ubuntu 17.04 once I installed the Solaar package. Otherwise only the mouse was paired with the unifying receiver. Solarr lets you pair multiple devices. It's available on github (posting a link here is not allowed). Keys are OK for an inexpensive non-mechanical keyboard. I would not do a lot of writing or programming but for casual use it is OK. Mouse is actually pretty good;: it even mostly works on glass (1/4", bottom surface frosted) but works better on paper or fabric. For the price, it's hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Boyes

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard is OK, but the mouse is tiny and awful! Should have been noted in the description. isn't
customer_reviews.text: Typical Logitech quality. Seems well built. Even comes with the batteries pre installed. Why only two stars? The mouse is stupidly small! It's like made for a small child. After 15 minutes my hand was cramped up, so I had to toss it out. There's no way any adult could use this without getting cramps. It should have been clearly marked "Extra small mouse". I don't know if there's an industry standard for mouse size, but I'm sure this isn't it.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Time will tell
customer_reviews.text: When I went on to purchase this keyboard set it was due to the need for working at home with the crazy work we live in. The one issue I have is when I ordered the keyboard I was told it t was not in stock. I do feel that what I received was the different package option I did not want. Well it arrived ahead of time due to the switch which was time saving but if the lack of packaging has caused any damage to the device I will be returning it as it does look like it was beat up during shipping.
customer_reviews.author: No one's business

customer_reviews.title: nice size and reactive keys... legs keep breaking
customer_reviews.text: I actually really like the keyboard and mouse but I broke a leg on one again. I have purchased 4 of these and 2 of them are functional except for the broken legs. I would have given a higher rating if that wasn't a problem. I use them at work so trying to use one that is too flat or unbalanced is just not really an option. Is it possible to get replacement legs?
customer_reviews.author: L D Parker

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great for me. The keyboard is a bit noisier than others, not an issue for me at all, but something of note if you need silence for a home office, etc. Pro Tip - the USB is wedged in the cardboard packaging. I opened mine from the side, and thus had a very hard time finding it. Assumed it was missing since it wasn't in the mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Ayesha Gold

customer_reviews.title: Only mouse is useful.
customer_reviews.text: My unit has bulky USB transmitter instead of miniature that was pictured on the listing. The keyboard is always sleeping,needs some time to start typing after a few seconds and missing characters. Or batteries are missing contact and need to be reinserted,ore batteries are already dead. So keyboard is always asking to be thrown into trash. Mouse is good,no delay and good battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Meyer Rotschild

customer_reviews.title: Product came in defective... How did this even pass quality check?
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to take my new keyboard/mice to my office today but then realized that it came apart once I opened the box... My "Enter" button fell off and I thought it was just an easy fix and just click it back on the keyboard but nope. It does not completely stay on securely and falls off time to time when I am typing. Also, my asterisk button does not work as good as all the other buttons. It takes me about 5 tries to finally get the asterisk button to work and thats actually one of my main buttons I need for work.... Tried contacting and submitting a claim to logitech but still no response...
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Cao

customer_reviews.title: Good basic mouse and keypad
customer_reviews.text: After getting rid of the desktop I bought these to use with the laptop on a standard monitor at my desk with no dock. They work fine and I've had no issues with either one. One USB adapter runs both mouse and keyboard. The only odd thing to me was getting used to the mouse having no IR light under it. The mouse works fine, my old mouse had an IR light for me to check if it was on and working. Both of these items work very well.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Like every other wireless mouth
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard and mouse combo work as expected. Quiet keyboard, stas connected and the mouse is very responsive. When you buy this product, don't assume the wireless plug in Bluetooth adapter is missing. Which is what I originally thought. Like every other wireless mouth, the coonector should be in there right? I opened it up and saw nothing there. I thought it would be attached to the keyboard...Nope. So I requested an exhange. They were very prompt. But here is the kicker, I opened the box through the other end and saw and there was the adapter. Smh. Anyhoot, it well woth the price and so far no issues whatsoever. More importantly, their customer service is great.
customer_reviews.author: Marcelino Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Buy a different version of Logitech
customer_reviews.text: After the first keyboard only working for a day. I hoped and thought it was the battery’s or my usb but double checked using the same port and it worked fine for my yeti. They sent me out another keyboard no charge and samething but this one only lasted 30-1hr. This is after I had purchased this keyboard at 29.99 unlike now they’re at 19.99 hmm wonder why? Lol this version isn’t a good version but logitech is a great brand I just hope the newer versions are better. Now I have two broken keyboards. When I need it for work.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie Jade

customer_reviews.title: Sticky Key Syndrome
customer_reviews.text: After a bit over a year of daily use the keys have begun to stick. In order for them to work, you have to strike them dead center otherwise the keys hang. It began with just the "A" but has progressed to several other keys and the space bar. I really like some of its features, like global email retrieval and the volume controls for the speakers, but the sticky keys are a real PIA. Fortunately, I bought the 2 year extended warranty from Square Trade and hopefully they  handle it either with a new keyboard or a refund.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy unless you like settling for 50% - as in 50% functional, 50% reliable, 50% worth the money...
customer_reviews.text: Great mouse, terrible keyboard. Just writing those 4 words caused the keyboard to hiccup twice. Maybe it has something to do with the USB connector, but if that was the case then the mouse would have the same issue - which it does not. And by the way, I have a mini PC that sits on my desktop, less than 18 inches from my keyboard. Would love to like this combo, but in the end, the lack of reliability in the keyboard's connection causes this product to be a fail. Maybe Bluetooth is better? Regardless though, I would say this combo pack is a skip.
customer_reviews.author: Spewbaca

customer_reviews.title: The most bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: Here we go, this is an inexpensive wireless combo, Great for when you only have a limited number of USB ports, hello! The batteries last for years, even with my every day use. If you're a big person and don't like your hands and arms grouped together so closely, I would recommend an ergonomic version. Thanks. :)
customer_reviews.author: Chris A.

customer_reviews.title: Best cheap wireless combo.  Only for close range
customer_reviews.text: The range is not good on these. I've seen it not work when a computer was three feet away under the desk. The easy fix is to buy a USB extension cable to bring the reciever within a foot of the the items. Then it works flawlessly. The battery life has been very good. I would recommend spending a little more for a better product if your receiver is not going to be very close to your items. If it is going to be very close though, buy with confidence, this will work grat.
customer_reviews.author: Justin B.

customer_reviews.title: Noisier now, compact, cheap
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd set of this unit I have because I like it. It's compact, it's cheap, and it works well. So when I needed another, I ordered this without thinking too much about it because I know it's a good unit. The most recent one I got is noticeably louder now than previous versions. This can be somewhat of a distraction to office mates if you type hard or fast. I'm a little disappointed that Logitech seems to have cheapened out on an otherwise great unit.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomerMN

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware: NOT UNIFYING!
customer_reviews.text: This is not a unifying logitech device. It is using another technology and is not compatible with logitech unifying devices. As far as functionality goes, it worked well. Before buying, you should look at Logitech's Unifying devices, and be sure you don't want one of them instead of these more generic devices.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: The mouse makes a loud clicking noise every time you click a button, but otherwise is perfectly fine. The keyboard is very slow to start up, forgets that you are in the middle of typing from time to time, and the keys stick most of the time. When I type a paragraph or two at a time it literally makes my the side of my thumb hurt from the space bar sticking and then popping into my thumb on release. I can't wait till my new keyboard arrives so I can take this one outside and smash it into the pavement!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love them!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very responsive. I type for hours every day, and I love how this keyboard feels. The keys offer the right amount of resistance - soft enough not to make you tired, but firm enough to offer good control and make you feel satisfied. They come with batteries, which I did not expect at this price point but is greatly appreciated. I have only had these for a month, so I cannot speak about the battery life. Installation was a breeze. I just plugged the USB receiver, and they started working right away (PC running Windows 10).
customer_reviews.author: A. C.

customer_reviews.title: Crapshoot
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these, one for home one for my second home. The first one worked fine. The keys on the second one are maddening. Several of the keys require tremendous pressure in order to register. I type an email and look to see all the “r’s” and “t’s” are missing. I would return it but I need it constantly for work. I cannot have an interruption waiting for replacement. Plus I threw away the shipping box- I am not about to purchase a box to send back. If you buy one of these, be sure you test it thoroughly before burning the bridge.
customer_reviews.author: Mick Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Shocked at the performance.  terrible terrible device.
customer_reviews.text: I really hate this Keyboard and mouse combo. There is often a delay in recognizing key strokes, or it won't recognize it at all even after several presses The mouse is very jerky and stutters. I would have been better off walking through alleys and finding a keyboard and mouse laying in a trash pile. I REALLY REALLY HATE THIS KEYBOARD! normally i'd just take it as a loss, but this piece of garbage needs to be returned. I'd be better off wondering through alleys or looking in dumpsters for a new keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Blechelstien

customer_reviews.title: this is an excellent buy for notebook users who have to work long ...
customer_reviews.text: Reliable and well shaped. Would have graded it higher, but the keys are somewhat stiff with too high a travel--typing is work, compared to the Microsoft keyboard, for example. But the price is right, and having the separate input devices increased the useability of my notebook over a full workday enormously from an ergonomic viewpoint, especially in tandem with a standing desk. If you can live with the harder keys. this is an excellent buy for notebook users who have to work long hours, and a much cheaper alternative to a separate monitor--just elevate the computer to ideal eye height, and leave the keyboard and mouse on the desk.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: use is intermittent at best
customer_reviews.text: I've never had a bad Logitech product, until now . I noticed when i first got it it sometimes didn't turn on. Now a month later the keyboard doesn't turn on unless the switch is turned on several times and then it might quit in the middle of a document, now the mouse is weird, jumps around on the screen , it seems like it's playing a game with you ,After 3 months Logitech Service finally emailed me with suggestions about a fix, after an hour of playing with it I'd had enough and tossed it all in the trash. I know Logitech builds good products, but for me this wasn't one of them.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: LOGITECH LET ME DOWN
customer_reviews.text: PURCHASE 7/2019.... This is my second purchase. I love my first, and it is still working very well. This one the keys started to crunch down on the side of the key, creating a resistance when typing or using the enter or number keys. It didn't last very long, less than 1 year of use.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Price

customer_reviews.title: Very Poorly Made
customer_reviews.text: I got these because they advertised "dropout free" which I took to mean no delay in typing or mouse pointer....I was wrong. Took 1-4 seconds for the keyboard to begin typing after touching keys and the mouse battery continued to fall from it's position rendering the mouse useless until you take it apart and jam the battery back in. I have always trusted Logitech products, but these were a disappointment. Spend a little more and get a better product, or do what I did and just get the wired version it's for a desktop.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: It's just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I decided to get a keyboard and mouse so my firstgraders could use my laptop. I chose this combo because I liked the brand and price. It arrived quickly. I set it up and both the mouse and keyboard worked immediately. A plus would have been a mouse pad included in the combo. I'm very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa A Brashares

customer_reviews.title: Works well for me!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use in pretty close range to my laptop (about a foot or so away, with my laptop set on a stand for ergonomic purposes). The connection for both is solid. Over the holidays my mom used it while her laptop was hooked up to the TV, the distance was ~7 feet and the connection worked really well. The little legs on the keyboard broke off- a friend accidentally stepped on the keyboard- which isn't a huge hindrance but I enjoyed using them. All in all, I'd say for around $20 it's been a great investment and would recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Boddy

customer_reviews.title: Works Great.
customer_reviews.text: Logitech has always exceeded my expectations. I find that researching and READING everything not only in the ads and information here but also via searches online and YouTube videos etc, ALWAYS increases my experience 1,000% ie: I downloaded a program that allow me to program / personalize the keys to fit my needs like moving the Caps Lock key because my big fingers hit it by mistake a lot. It does a lot on its own and works great. Enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Bates family

customer_reviews.title: Sketchy operation
customer_reviews.text: Both keyboards feel well below expectations. The non-consistent response for both the mouse and keyboard made the continued use impossible. Sadly we discarded the packaging. I guess you get what you pay for. The new wireless units we purchased are working great. Wasted time and money on these wireless sets.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E Federau

customer_reviews.title: Mouse Sensor Failing
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this product twice. Once from Amazon and once from a local Target. The mouse sensor on the left click button seems to start to fail after some time. When I try to drag and drop or highlight something, it doesn't work and starts to ask quirky. The price is good value, but plan on purchasing one/year. Wish I could just replace the mouth at a cheaper cost and keep keyboard and USB transmitter.
customer_reviews.author: House of Dlug

customer_reviews.title: Easy and stress free
customer_reviews.text: All I care about is if something is easy to use and works. This keyboard and mouse do both. It is very easy to use. It works and is responsive to my typing. It lights up when the caps lock key is on which is very useful. There are buttons to mute quickly and to pull up the calculator. Nothing fancy just ease. We have purchased a number of these for both home and office and so far they have held up and are working great. I don't know about all the technical stuff other reviewers are talking about but just know I like easy!
customer_reviews.author: noni0109

customer_reviews.title: but this is perfect for our conference room
customer_reviews.text: Not the sturdiest set out there, but this is perfect for our conference room. The key was the range and stability of the wireless connection. Its worked from being plugged in and probably die when the batteries die. I've used $100 sets and they lose connection (where you have to unplug and replug in the USB dongle), this by far is the best value for our needs.
customer_reviews.author: PiyoPiyo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Us.
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard and mouse. We use it with our laptop and a monitor to create the comfort of a desktop while keeping the flexibility of the laptop. The keyboard and mouse both connect wirelessly via a small USB drive that is flat (almost flush) to the laptop when plugged in. The keyboard keys are curved slightly and they have a nice spring in them making it very comfortable to type. The mouse is small and has a sensitive sensor. We don't have wires all over our desk and the mouse travels well in a pocket when we take the laptop with us. I would recommend to anyone who the same goal in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Conner

customer_reviews.title: Great Set!
customer_reviews.text: I am working from home temporarily so I ordered the wireless keyboard & mouse to eliminate the mess of wires. I love the feel and responsiveness of both. They could not have possibly been easier to connect. I am very happy with the quality and price. They make working at home much easier, I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I have a smart board in my classroom and this prevents me from having to stand up there by it all day. I LOVE IT! And my mom just gifted me a second one, which I will absolutely find a use for. Well made and the mouse is durable. My students have dropped it FIVE HUNDRED MILLION BILLION TIMES in the past year and it's still working. Heck, I'm still using the batteries it came with over a year later. The range it decent, it gets a little weak after 20 or 30 feet. That may also be due to the fact that it is in the back of my smartboard, not the front. Overall, a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Full Sized Keyboard Handy If Used To Typing
customer_reviews.text: Touchscreen, Tech Support and Camera Quality do not apply with this rating. I like the full size keyboard with all key functions all on the one keyboard in one place. I learned how to type and input on a keyboard and type fast on a keyboard. Thus I am more accurate where I can "feel" the keys as I type and the keys are not smooth across on them like they are on my laptop computer.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this set for a while on my work laptop. It's been great with NO issues. This set may be cheap but it does not feel as though it was cheaply made. The mouse does require a mouse pad whereas other mice I've used can be easily tracked on the desk. Battery lasts a very long time in both keyboard and mouse. I've used wireless gaming mice on my main computer and many other types of wireless keyboards. This set is perfect for everyday light use and travel. I love the off switches on both!
customer_reviews.author: CloudD901

customer_reviews.title: Keys fall off too easily
customer_reviews.text: I was cleaning my desk and had to put the keyboard away. I tried to throw it on my bed which is about a foot away, but my hand slipped and the keyboard fell on the floor. The keyboard practically fell apart on impact. Keys were everywhere. Mind you, I threw the thing with minimal force and it fell for only a little over 2 feet before it hit the wooden floor. I still can't find my ESC and 0 key. I know I'm partially at fault here for being careless, but I expected the keyboard to be a bit stronger than that.
customer_reviews.author: mingzl8106

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: I have found the best way to keep your laptop safe from drops is to use 1 of these. If I drop this key board on the floor I am only out 20 bucks. Over the years I have tried other brands but this 1 is the best. The batteries last a long time. I have dropped it several times & it just deeps working.
customer_reviews.author: some beach

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT work as designed
customer_reviews.text: I have always been ok with anything from Logitech but this keyboard is junk. I had reservations ordering such an inexpensive keyboard but since it was Logitech I went ahead and did it. NEVER again...such a pain in the a.... trying to type and realizing your input isnt being typed. I tried new batteries TWICE.....it seems like the issue is very much like low batteries but I replaced twice with new Energizer batteries and not some ole cheap brand so I know thats not the case. I have put up wioth it for so long now it is too late to return. ( about 3 months old now ) Spend $20 more and get a decent 1 !!!
customer_reviews.author: Westin

customer_reviews.title: Never again!
customer_reviews.text: Updated review: I did like this product but now after spending nearly a year with 3 of these things I could not recommend this set because of the mouse. The most annoying thing is when you click something and it tries to drag or doesn't accept your click . I have never experienced this type of thing with any other mouse. This happens on all 3 sets I use. Booo. Booo, Logitech for allowing this product to be released. The keyboard is fine enough I guess and the battery also does last a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Daedre

customer_reviews.title: Can't touch-type because keys have to be more fully depressed
customer_reviews.text: Having a wireless keyboard and mouse is great. But the G and R keys regularly do not engage unless I press them pretty hard. So I'm not able to touch-type in the same way I previously did. And when I type any word with those letters, I often have to retype the word or at least retype the letters. I want to like this keyboard, but it's driving me a little crazy. It just slows me down on everything I do because I have to type a little more firmly (which slows me down) and then I have to double-check everything I type.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Collins

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This is a horrible product. It was inoperative when I received it. Technical support from Logitech is the very worst anywhere. I tried to get help from non-tech savvy employees and got nowhere. I sent an email complaint two days ago. No response yet. 3 business days and no solution. A different tech is on the case. He said the first tech provided a solution, which of course, didn't work. So, round and round we go. 8 business days later, I received this email (in part): We’ve forwarded your warranty request for review. It may take up to two business days to process. The expected delivery time is 7-10 business days after the warranty replacement has been shipped.
customer_reviews.author: JP Georgia

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great keyboard and mouse combo. This was bought for me when I took a new position 6 months ago and I am still using it and am happy with these "throwaway peripherals" at this price point (if that makes sense). At home I have a much nicer keyboard and mouse, but obviously they were exponentially more expensive, and I expect those to last me ~5 years and am disappointed if they do not. For the price, this is a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Namrezy

customer_reviews.title: This is a great, affordable combo
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, affordable combo. I really like the quick access controls that are at the top of the keyboard so that I can easily adjust volume, mute, or just access the calculator. I appreciate the angle that is achieved when using the flip-out legs. A lot of keyboards that I've used give almost no additional height, but this keyboard is very comfortable to use. It's also nice that it's fairly quiet and not too clacky. The mouse is pretty standard. My desk is a light-colored wood with dark grains that sometimes cause the mouse to jump, but I got a mousepad that creates a flat, single-color surface that solved that issue completely.
customer_reviews.author: Devin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect setup over a year now
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my home office over a year ago, it has never given me an issue to this day. I keep the keyboard and mouse on always and still have yet to replace the battery in the keyboard and only a couple times in the mouse. The range is great, I have had it across the room and still no lag or delay at all. Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.author: James Misu

customer_reviews.title: You can't beat this bundle for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my PC (Windows), but ended up using it for my Nexus Player (Android). Yes, I can surf the web (using Google Chrome) from my couch on my HDTV using my Nexus Player running Android 7.1.1 The single adapter that supports both the mouse and the keyboard simultaneously are great for mobile devices that only have 1 USB port. Good that both the mouse and keyboard have an ON/OFF switch, to conserve power. The keyboard uses 2 AAA batteries, the mouse uses a single AA battery, IIRC. Even the home key, etc on the keyboard work under Android. Will update this review when I get an idea of the battery life..
customer_reviews.author: n-squared

customer_reviews.title: Not the qualtiy I expected from Logitech.
customer_reviews.text: I hadn't even tried it and my friend told me that his was terrible. I was hoping he was wrong. He was right. It will just cut out in the MIDDLE of typing. So does the mouse. I probably have a lot of 2.4ghz interference in the home but who doesn't? I am less than 10 feet from the receiver and this is patchy at best. I don't understand why it got such great reveiws. I tried different downloads from Logitech support site and nothing improves the function. It does work, albeit terribly, with Windows and Raspbian right out of the box. Logitech makes some AWESOME stuff, but this is not one of those products. I'm actually returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Keyword keeps getting disconnected
customer_reviews.text: It has been exactly 13 months since my purchase. The mouse is fine but, the keyboard keeps getting disconnected. I've changed new batteries, I've turned the power button on and off several times but, the issue keeps happening. It would stop and then it would start working again. I believe the warranty is out now so it is very frustrating to have to purchase another set. This is something that sound be more reliable and should last a little longer.
customer_reviews.author: moving girl

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Wireless Combo
customer_reviews.text: This is a review of the "Logitech Wireless Combo MK270 with Keyboard and Mouse." I find that I have to identify the product I'm reviewing because sometimes my reviews for one item are compiled with other reviews for multiple items in a related product line. The Logitech Wireless Combo is a great combo. It has responsive keys, good mouse buttons, and a nice, tactile scroll wheel. There is no perceptible lag and the range is excellent. It isn't backlit or ergonomic as some people prefer, particularly for gaming, but it is quite good for regular office use. Overall, we really like it and use it daily.
customer_reviews.author: Humble Patriot

customer_reviews.title: Highly functional and configurable combo, but irritating auto-center mouse feature
customer_reviews.text: I do enjoy the ergonomics of the keyboard and mouse plus the configurable options on both, but the smart logic on the mouse to center what it ‘thinks’ is the center of what I’m looking at has me wanting to spike this thing on my office floor like I just ran a 100yd kickoff back for a touchdown. I haven’t found a way to turn off the auto-center option so it daily irritates me. Aside from that feature I really like the combo
customer_reviews.author: James Rainwater

customer_reviews.title: Feels Great on the fingers.
customer_reviews.text: I’m pretty big when it comes to keyboards, I need a certain type of response feeling in order for me to type effectively. If the keys require to much pressure to type than my typing results will suck. I think it’s because I’m use to typing on a MacBook Pro 2015 and it’s effortlessness to type on those. With that being said it take a little more pressure to type on the key board than I’m use to but still it’s smooth,responsive and feels great on my fingers. The mouse isn’t all that but the keyboard is what I needed most, I don’t use the mouse anyway. But this is a great keyboard especially for the price
customer_reviews.author: Issac
